title: Drupal - Views 3 menu tab visibilty
description: How to restrict Views menu tab visibility to certain content-types using Views 3 on Drupal 7.

children.value: Another Drupal 7/Views 3 howto for you this time. If you use a tab for your view's menu item (and have the path set to something like 'node/%/my_tab_name'), the default is for this tab to appear for all content types which come under the "node" bundle. This has rarely been what I want, so I'm going to show you how to restrict the visibility of the tab to certain content types.
It's done via the contextual filter settings. If you aren't using contextual filters, you can add a "Global: Null" filter, with the following setting:
IN THE URL: Display all results for the specified field
To set the menu restriction, use the following settings:
Content Type: Tick the content type(s) on which you'd like the tab to appear
Action to take if filter value does not validate: Show "Page not found"

Now apply your settings, and your tab should only appear on the relevant content types! I'm working fairly extensively with Drupal at the moment, so expect a few more posts of this ilk in the near future!
